message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.GR 

The paper proposes a method for editing talking-head videos based on their transcript, which involves annotating the video with various parameters such as phonemes, visemes, 3D face pose and geometry, reflectance, expression, and scene illumination per frame. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category, as it involves analyzing and manipulating visual data. Additionally, the paper uses a recurrent video generation network to transform the intermediate video representation to a photorealistic video, which suggests that it may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. The paper also involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as language translation and full sentence synthesis, which suggests that it may belong to the computational linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category. The paper uses an optimization strategy to choose segments of the input corpus as base material, which suggests that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves rendering the lower half of the face with a parametric face model, which suggests that it may also belong to the graphics (cs.GR) sub-category.
